datafield.subfield: King, F. Gasoline Alley. "You thunk up a notion, Joel?" [graphic] 1965 Apr. 6 [publication date]:

(Dick Moores (Dec. 12,1909 - Apr. 22, 1986, USA); Richard Arnold Moores b. in Lincoln, Neb.; studied art at the Chicago Art Academy; worked as assist. to Chester Gould on the backgrounds & lettering of "Dick Tracy" 1932 -1936; turned to animation in 1942, & joined the Disney Studios; there, worked on several animation projects as well as comic series; worked mainly on newspaper strips during the 1940s & 1950s; in 1956, Frank King asked him to assist on the daily "Gasoline Alley" strip, which he took over competely after its creator's retirement in 1959; drew "Gasoline Alley" until his death in 1986)
(Dick Moores, comic strip creator, best known for the comic strip Gasoline Alley)
